Package server

Class Game

java.lang.Object
server.Game
public class Game extends Object
Game class is the central component of the server side, which contents the total logical functions of the Game Love Letter. Moreover, Game is also applied as a "Database" for the temporary storage of all the information of the cards and players during the game.
Author:
can ren, pascal stucky, yuliia shaparenko

      public Game()

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Game getInstance()
      constructor Game: With singleton (DCL), the constructor will return only one instance of the class Game.
      Returns:
      only one instance of the Game

    • startGame

      public void startGame() throws IOException
      This method startGame() will start a new game for the players. In the while-loop, the game-over condition will be checked. If not enough tokens are gained by the players, the game will continue to a new round, till the game-over condition is accomplished.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • newRound

      public void newRound()
      This method newRound() simulates the scenario during one play round. In the while-loop, the round-over condition will be checked. If the condition is accomplished, the current round will be over and a new round will be started. Otherwise, round will continue.

    • guessType

      public void guessType​(String cardname) throws IOException
      This method will be invoked by client via server. Because only guard card type needs a guessType function, therefore this is only for playing guard card
      Parameters:
      cardname -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • choosePlayer

      public void choosePlayer​(String playername) throws IOException
      This method will be invoked by client via server. It will check which card is played and give the parameter to this card function.
      Parameters:
      playername -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • playCard

      public void playCard​(Card card) throws IOException
      This method playCard() checks first whether the played card is valid in respect of the game rules. In the switch-case, the type of the played card will be selected and the according function of the played card will be applied.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • endOfTurn

      public void endOfTurn() throws IOException
      If a card is played by one player, then his/her turn is over. Next player is in turn.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • checkRoundOver

      public void checkRoundOver()
      If there are no cards in the deck, or only one player left, then round over.

    • updateScoresAndTokensAndWinnersForThisRound

      public String updateScoresAndTokensAndWinnersForThisRound()
      This method will update the scores, tokens and winner name at the end of every round.
      Returns:
      winner name of this round will be returned

    • checkGameOver

      public void checkGameOver()
      This method checkGameOver() will check whether the condition of game over accomplished in respect of the game rules.

    • allPlayersProtected

      public boolean allPlayersProtected()
      This method allPlayersProtected() checked whether all the other active players in this round are protected by handmaid.
      Returns:
      false when not all the active players are protected by handmaids, otherwise return true.
